title: In a class, 60% of the students pass in English and 45% pass in Hindi. If 25% of them pass in both subjects, what percentage of the students fail in both the subjects? - Quora

response.answer_text: Perc of students pass in English=60 (E) Perc of students pass in Hindi=45 (H) Perc passed in both=25 (E intersection H) So, Percentage of students who passed in hindi or english (union) is: 60+45–25=80 (Principle of Inclusion and Exclusion) Now we will apply de Morgan’s Laws law which which make it ~(EuH)=~E intersection ~H that means students who didnot pass in English as well as Hindi which will be 100–80=20% . So 20% students failed in both the subjects! Please Note:- ~ means not/inverse here and u means union!
